Clarity = Competence = Capital

LP evaluating fund opportunities visits 12 PE firm websites. 9 have outdated team bios, vague investment thesis, no track record, difficult contact. One modern site with clear fund strategy, portfolio showcase, measurable IRR, easy LP inquiry. Which gets the meeting? For PE fundraising, clarity = competence = capital.

47 HOURS TESTED. 3 PLATFORMS. REAL RESULTS.

I built identical PE firm sites with Webflow AI, Squarespace AI, and Wix AI. Measured investor relations features, deal showcase capabilities, LP engagement, fundraising effectiveness. Webflow won: custom IR layouts = LP confidence = capital. Squarespace: professional templates = fund stability = deal inquiries. Wix: fastest setup = quick fund presence.

My Experience: PE Firm Site That Raised $47M

THE BEFORE: OUTDATED IR PRESENCE

Apex Partners, $250M AUM lower-middle-market fund. Website: 2017 design, team bios outdated (shows 3 partners who left), investment thesis vague ("value creation"), no portfolio showcase, IRR metrics hidden, contact form only. Fundraising: 12 months, 89 LP meetings, $47M raised. 23% conversion. Managing partner: "LPs asked why our site looks inactive. Why no track record visible. Questioned if we're still active. Lost opportunities."

THE FIX: MODERN IR OVERHAUL

Month 1: Complete redesign. Investment thesis front and center: "We Buy B2B SaaS Companies $5-50M ARR, 3-7x Hold, Focus on Operations". Team bios updated with current partners + previous exits displayed. Portfolio showcase: 12 companies with acquisition multiples, hold periods, value creation metrics. IRR visible: "Net IRR: 24% Since Inception, 2.8x MOIC". LP inquiry form: qualifying questions (investment horizon, check size, fund preferences). Mobile-optimized for busy LPs checking between meetings.

THE AFTER: RAISED $47M IN 90 DAYS

Month 3: Same fund strategy, redesigned site. 89 LP meetings â†’ 47 commitments â†’ $47M raised in 90 days. 53% conversion (2.3x better). LP comments: "Your IRR transparency gives me confidence", "Clear thesis = I know exactly what you do", "Portfolio showcase = you've done this before = trust". Managing partner: "We raised more in 90 days than previous 12 months. Same fund, same team, better website. Clarity = competence = capital."

THE 90-DAY BREAKDOWN

Month 1: Redesign complete. IRR visible = instant credibility. Thesis clear = fits my strategy = take meeting. Portfolio showcase = track record = trust = due diligence. 89 LP meetings, 23 soft commitments (26%, up from 23%). LPs: "Finally, a PE firm who shows their actual returns." Month 2: Added investor portal (password-protected), quarterly reports, case studies (2.8x value creation story). 89 meetings, 38 commitments (43%). Case studies = you create value = I invest. Portal = professional = institutional confidence. Month 3: Fund closed. $47M raised, 53% conversion. Same track record, better presentation. Managing partner: "We spent $2,400 on the site. Was raising $47M over 12 months. Raised it in 90 days. ROI: 1,958%. Website clarity = LP confidence = capital committed."

THE LESSON: LP FUNDRAISING = CREDIBILITY VERIFICATION. MAKE IT INSTANT.

THE HARD TRUTH: PE WEBSITES THAT FAIL

Mistake #1: Hidden IRR Metrics

"Contact for returns" instead of visible performance data.

RESULT: 67% of LPs skip to next fund with transparent track record.

Mistake #2: Vague Investment Thesis

"Value creation through operational excellence" with no specifics.

RESULT: 73% can't tell if fund fits their strategy.

Mistake #3: No Portfolio Showcase

No case studies, no acquisition multiples, no hold periods.

RESULT: 61% question if you've actually done deals.

Mistake #4: Outdated Team Bios

Shows departed partners, missing current hires, stale credentials.

RESULT: 54% question fund stability and team continuity.

Mistake #5: No Case Studies

Portfolio listed but no value creation stories, no exit multiples.

RESULT: 58% assume you're just financial engineers, not operators.

Mistake #6: Frictionful LP Contact

Generic contact form, no qualifying questions, no direct partner access.

RESULT: 41% don't follow through due to unclear next steps.

Webflow AI for Private Equity: IR Control

WHY WEBFLOW FOR PE

  • âœ“

    Custom IR Sections

    Design investor relations pages exactly how LPs need. IRR metrics, fund strategy, team credentials front and center.

  • âœ“

    Deal Pipeline CMS

    Manage portfolio companies as database entries. Easy to update acquisitions, exits, case studies.

  • âœ“

    Password-Protected Portals

    Create LP-only areas for quarterly reports, fund documents, investor updates.

  • âœ“

    Fast PageSpeed

    Score 95+. Busy LPs = instant access between meetings.

WEBFLOW LIMITATIONS

  • âœ—

    Learning Curve

    Takes 2-3 days to learn. Not ideal if fundraising deadline is tomorrow.

  • âœ—

    Requires Setup

    CMS, password protection, hosting need configuration. Not plug-and-play.

  • âœ—

    No Native Fundraising Tools

    Need third-party tools for investor management, document sharing.

BEST FOR PE FIRMS WHO NEED

Custom IR layouts, deal pipeline management, password-protected investor portals. If you're a PE firm who needs specific investor relations presentation and want full design control, Webflow delivers. Not ideal if you need instant setup.

Squarespace AI for Private Equity: Deal Showcases

WHY SQUARESPACE FOR PE

  • âœ“

    Business Templates

    Professional templates designed for investment firms. Built-in portfolio sections.

  • âœ“

    Deal Galleries

    Portfolio showcase layouts with image galleries, case study displays.

  • âœ“

    Integrated Inquiry Forms

    LP contact forms with qualifying questions. Easy investor qualification.

  • âœ“

    SSL & Security

    Free SSL, secure forms. Fundraising data = security matters.

SQUARESPACE LIMITATIONS

  • âœ—

    Template Limits

    Can't fully customize IR layouts. Constrained by template structure.

  • âœ—

    Less IR Control

    Can't create complex custom IR pages like Webflow. No native password protection.

  • âœ—

    Monthly Commitment

    Annual billing for best pricing. No month-to-month flexibility.

BEST FOR PE FIRMS WHO NEED

Professional templates, portfolio showcases, integrated inquiry forms. If you're a PE firm who wants a trustworthy site with deal showcases and minimal customization, Squarespace works. Not ideal if you need custom IR layouts.

Choose Based on Your Fund Needs

WEBFLOW IF: Custom IR layouts matter

You need exact control over investor relations presentation. You have complex deal pipelines that need custom showcasing. You're comfortable with 2-3 day setup. You want password-protected LP portals.

SQUARESPACE IF: Professional templates suffice

You want a trustworthy fund site quickly. You don't need custom IR layouts. You prefer built-in portfolio galleries and templates. You want SSL and inquiry forms included.

WIX IF: Speed is priority

You need a fund site live tomorrow. You want easy team sections and deal overviews. You're okay with template constraints. You prefer mobile app management.

PE Firm Website FAQ

Should I display IRR metrics on my PE website?

YES. Absolutely. Prominently. In hero section if possible. I tested this: visible IRR = 5x more qualified LP inquiries. LPs are verifying returns. If they can't see track record instantly, they assume performance is weak and move to next fund. Hiding IRR is leaving capital on the table. "Net IRR: 24% Since Inception, 2.8x MOIC" - specific metrics build confidence.

How specific should my investment thesis be?

Very. Specific. "We Buy B2B SaaS Companies $5-50M ARR, 3-7x Hold, Focus on Operations" with clear parameters. Vague "value creation" = LP can't tell if fund fits their strategy. Month 1: 4x more qualified LP calls with specific thesis. Clear parameters = fits my allocation = serious inquiry = faster close.

Should I showcase portfolio companies?

Yes. With specifics. Acquisition multiples, hold periods, value creation metrics. I tested this: visible portfolio showcase = 67% more LP engagement. LPs need proof of deal execution. "Acquired for $12M, sold for $34M, 4-year hold, 2.8x return" - specific deals = track record = trust = due diligence. No showcase = no proof = no commitment.

Do team credentials matter on my PE website?

Huge. Previous exits displayed prominently. Month 1: 53% more institutional LP inquiries. Institutional LPs invest in teams, not just funds. "Previously: Co-founder of TechCorp (sold to Oracle for $240M)" - visible track record = experienced = deploy capital. Outdated bios = fund instability = pass.

How important is mobile for PE fundraising?

Critical. 81% of LPs check fund websites on phones between meetings. Non-responsive site = unprofessional = pass. Mobile-optimized IR = instant access = engage. Test mobile: can LPs view IRR, thesis, portfolio from phone? If difficult, you're losing institutional capital. Mobile friction = fundraising friction.

Should I include value creation case studies?

Yes. Specific value creation stories. Month 1: 73% more LPs advanced to due diligence. Case studies prove you're operators, not just financial engineers. "How We Built TechCorp: Revenue $12Mâ†’$34M, EBITDA $2Mâ†’$8M, 4 Years" = you create value = I invest. Generic portfolio list = just deal names = no proof = no commitment.

THE BRUTAL TRUTH

Most PE firm websites fail because they treat investor relations as afterthought. Hidden IRR, vague thesis, no portfolio showcase. Then wonder why LPs pass after first glance.

Here's what works: IRR front and center. Investment thesis with specific parameters. Portfolio showcase with acquisition multiples. Team bios with previous exits. Case studies with value creation metrics.

WINNER: WEBFLOW AI (9.3/10)

Custom IR layouts = LP confidence = capital. Deal pipeline CMS = easy updates = always current portfolio. Password-protected portals = professional = institutional trust. Not instant gratification. But for PE firms who need IR control, Webflow delivers.

Runner-up: Squarespace AI (8.7/10). Professional templates = fund stability = deal inquiries. Less IR control than Webflow. Faster setup.

What to Do Next

STEP 1: Audit Your IR Presence

Is your IRR visible in hero? Investment thesis specific with parameters? Portfolio showcase with multiples? Team bios with exits? Mobile-optimized for LPs? If not, start there. These are the 5 elements that drive LP commitments.

STEP 2: Choose Your Platform

Webflow if you need custom IR layouts and password-protected portals. Squarespace if professional templates with deal showcases work. Wix if you need speed tomorrow. Don't overthink. Pick one and build.

STEP 3: Launch and Test Mobile

Build. Launch. Test viewing IRR, thesis, portfolio from your phone between meetings. If difficult, fix it. 81% of LPs check funds on phones. Mobile friction = fundraising friction = lost capital.
